item.title: Raquel add a quote by John Stangeland
item.description: "In the complete portrait of Warren William there is no legacy, only a career. What we are doing when we see him on screen is simply watching a man work. If he has a legacy at all, it is not in his craft, but in the incredible success he had in remaining true to himself." -- John Stangeland

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Allan Wolf
item.description: "... my aim in writing The Watch That Ends the Night was not to present history. My aim was to present humanity. The people represented in this book lived and breathed and loved. They were as real as you or me. They could have been any one of us." -- Allan Wolf

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Patrick Ness
item.description: "Shout for libraries. Shout for the young readers who use them." -- Patrick Ness

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Teresa Flavin
item.description: "This place is alive," Sunni said in wonder. "Things are moving. Inside a painting." -- Teresa Flavin

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Patrick Ness
item.description: "... a good idea always attracts other good ideas." -- Patrick Ness

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Atwood H. Townsend
item.description: "No matter how busy you may think you are, you must find time for reading, or surrender yourself to self-chosen ignorance." -- Atwood H. Townsend

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "All happy families are alike; each unhappy family is unhappy in its own way." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "Poetry is an act of peace. Peace goes into the making of a poet as flour goes into the making of bread." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Elizabeth Gaskell
item.description: "...the prospect of soon losing her companion seemed to give force to every sweet quality and charm which Edith possessed." -- Elizabeth Gaskell

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Graham Greene
item.description: "We are possessed by nobody, not even by ourselves." -- Graham Greene

item.title: Raquel add a quote by William Blake
item.description: "Tyger! Tyger! burning bright In the forests of the night, What immortal hand or eye Could frame thy fearful symmetry?" -- William Blake

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Gigi Amateau
item.description: "Nanny had thought she might lose the child from her grief. At night when she rolled over in the bed and went to drape her leg across Gabriel’s, finding him gone, the ache in Nanny’s chest moved up to her throat, then down to her womb." -- Gigi Amateau
